Some people use immodium and other subs. For me and the people I've talked to, cold turkey is best. I'm coming off a relapse and I'm struggling pretty hard right now. But I KNOW if I used a sub I'd just get hooked on that. Find an NA meeting. If you have any clean friends, ask if you can spend the day with them. When I very first detoxed, the withdrawals killed me. I had a friend who let me stay at his house for like 4 days. He just sat with me and watched the original Star Trek and made me tea and let me be pathetic and cuddle up with him. I don't know if I would have made it without his support. Another thing that really helped me was just doing some research. I spent hours looking up everything I could about withdrawals so I would know how long they normally last and what I could expect. That was helpful for me because I could tell myself "okay this sucks right now but it'll be over soon." If you don't have any clean friends, this is a great GREAT place to come. You can pm me and I'll give you my number if you want. So many people here are great about being supportive and helping you through it. I really can't recommend NA enough either. It's scary and intimidating the first time but it is SO worth it. If you go and introduce yourself as a newcomer they'll give you a list of phone numbers of people there that you can call if you're having a hard time.
Just keep your head up. Know that even though you feel like you're going to die YOU AREN'T. You've got this. Best of luck to ya. :)

WRITING.TEXT:
First of all, I'm just going to apologize for being THAT obnoxious person who keeps coming back and forth. I'm trying. I've just struggling right now. And I'm sorry if it's a bit of a read.. I just need some where to tell what's been going on and hopefully get my head on straight.

Some things because of my own actions, and some that are out of my control. The main thing that's been messing with my head is that my ex boyfriend who I helped send to jail for physical and sexual assault got out of jail about 2 months ago and has been doing things that are just flat out not okay and giving me shit basically since he got out. I'm trying to figure out what I can and should do legally and trying to deal with what's he's doing. It's messing with my head and bringing up some hard memories. My anxiety flares up really badly whenever he's involved. I know that's not an excuse to use, it's just a major trigger I'm trying to work through.

I've seen quite a few people there I recognize from NA so I know it's definitely a better environment than where I was before. But new jobs are always stressful in the beginning. Which I know isn't the worst thing in the world. But I thought it was something I'd actually succeeded at quitting. Guess not.
I have a dealer I used to buy from giving me crazy amounts of shit right now, trying to get me to buy or inviting me over to come shoot up with them and freaking out at me when I say no thanks. I don't want to be rude to him. I keep telling him no thanks and that I'm trying not to do that anymore. But he won't leave me alone. From Facebook messages to texts and calls to texting and calling people he knows I hang out with. I don't know why he's so set on breaking me, but I can't get him to leave me alone.
